metadata.description: Comprehensive findings database for manuscript preparation

major_findings.title: Exponential Growth in Viral Diversity
major_findings.significance: Quantifies the transformative impact of technology on viral discovery

major_findings.title: Caudovirales Dissolution Mystery Solved
major_findings.significance: Demonstrates importance of semantic change classification

major_findings.title: First Git-Based Biological Taxonomy
major_findings.significance: Paradigm shift in biological data management

major_findings.title: Peak Single-Year Discovery

details.context: Largest single-year increase in ICTV history

major_findings.significance: Demonstrates continued acceleration of viral discovery

major_findings.title: Realm System Introduction and Adoption
major_findings.significance: Provides evolutionary framework for viral diversity

major_findings.title: Viral Classification Instability Quantified

details.double_reclassifications: Multiple Streptomyces phages changed twice in 2 years

major_findings.significance: First quantification of taxonomic volatility in virology
implications: Literature consistency compromised across thousands of papers

major_findings.title: Optimal Viral Family Size Discovered
major_findings.key_stat: 50-200 species per family identified as optimal range

optimal_range.rationale: Balance between phylogenetic coherence and practical manageability

major_findings.significance: First empirical evidence for optimal taxonomy structure

major_findings.title: Production REST API with 30+ Endpoints
major_findings.key_stat: Complete programmatic access to 20 years of taxonomy

technical_achievements.title: Automated Change Classification
technical_achievements.description: Three-tier system distinguishing reclassification, restructure, and nomenclature changes
technical_achievements.impact: Enables semantic understanding of taxonomic changes

technical_achievements.title: Migration Mapping Tools
technical_achievements.description: Automated dataset migration between any MSL version pair
technical_achievements.impact: Solves reproducibility crisis in viral research

technical_achievements.title: Historical Data Recovery
technical_achievements.description: Complete MSL archive from 2005-2024 including legacy formats

technical_achievements.title: Family Size Analysis Framework
technical_achievements.description: Research framework for analyzing optimal taxonomic organization
technical_achievements.impact: Provides empirical basis for taxonomy design

technical_achievements.title: Natural Language Query System
technical_achievements.description: AI-powered search across 20 years of taxonomy
technical_achievements.impact: Makes historical data accessible to non-programmers

data_issues_resolved.cause: MSL33 and MSL34 both released in 2018 causing division by zero
data_issues_resolved.resolution: Filter infinite values and handle same-year releases
data_issues_resolved.lesson: Data processing errors can hide major scientific insights

data_issues_resolved.cause: Major reorganizations create temporary data inconsistencies
data_issues_resolved.resolution: Developed quality scoring system with contextual interpretation
data_issues_resolved.finding_revealed: Low quality scores indicate major transitions, not errors
data_issues_resolved.lesson: Context essential for data quality interpretation

data_issues_resolved.cause: MSL23 in 2005 but only 18 versions by 2024
data_issues_resolved.finding_revealed: ICTV started numbering at MSL23, not MSL1
data_issues_resolved.lesson: Historical context crucial for data archaeology

predictive_insights.implications: Taxonomic frameworks must be designed for change

predictive_insights.basis: Current explosion in diversity straining existing ranks

predictive_insights.prediction: Next family splits: Straboviridae and Drexlerviridae

visual_elements.title: Discovery Rate by Era
visual_elements.shows: 35x acceleration from foundation to AI era

visual_elements.title: Family Size Distribution Evolution
visual_elements.shows: Optimal size range and splitting patterns

future_research_questions: How do taxonomic stability patterns correlate with viral host range?
Can machine learning predict which families will undergo reorganization?
What discovery biases exist in current sampling methods?
How does viral taxonomic evolution compare to bacterial or eukaryotic patterns?
What is the true scale of undiscovered viral diversity?
Do different genome architectures have different optimal family sizes?
How do recombination rates affect taxonomic stability?
Can phylogenetic signal degradation be quantified by family age?

key_messages.primary: Git-based version control revolutionizes biological data management, enabling unprecedented longitudinal analysis and predictive taxonomy
supporting: First empirical evidence for optimal viral family sizes (50-200 species)
Caudovirales dissolution validated by exceeding size thresholds
20-year analysis reveals 35x acceleration in discovery rates
Semantic change tracking essential for understanding taxonomic evolution
Complete historical preservation enables predictive insights
Software development practices solve big data biology challenges
